name: Harbor Basin
economy_niches: ritual-augury for navigation and voyage rites
culture_adjustments: guild authority supersedes kinship in urban governance
port-law and gift-exchange formalized into public ritual
heightened seamanship superstitions and augury customs
practical syncretism: docks host both secular trade rites and shrine offerings
constraints: heavy dependence on imported reagents for ritual augury
guild monopolies restrict access to docks and dry docks
timber scarcity limits construction of very large hulls
notes: customs houses and bonded sanctuaries concentrate state revenue
dry docks double as ritual workshops for navigational auguries
port-laws recorded orally; local adjudicators are guild-appointed
